quiz.title: Factoring by Grouping
quiz.subtitle: Unit 11 Quiz 2: Grouping Method for Factoring
quiz.subject: Mathematics

questions.question: Factor completely: $x^3 + 3x^2 + 4x + 12$
questions.explanation: Group the terms: $(x^3 + 3x^2) + (4x + 12)$. Factor out the GCF from each group: $x^2(x + 3) + 4(x + 3)$. Since $(x + 3)$ is common, the factored form is $(x^2 + 4)(x + 3)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $ax + ay + bx + by$
questions.explanation: Group: $(ax + ay) + (bx + by)$. Factor each group: $a(x + y) + b(x + y)$. Now factor out common binomial $(x + y)$: $(a + b)(x + y)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $2x^2 + 6x + 3x + 9$
questions.explanation: Group: $(2x^2 + 6x) + (3x + 9)$. Factor each group: $2x(x + 3) + 3(x + 3)$. Factor out $(x + 3)$: $(x + 3)(2x + 3)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $3y^2 - 9y + 4y - 12$
questions.explanation: Group: $(3y^2 - 9y) + (4y - 12)$. Factor each group: $3y(y - 3) + 4(y - 3)$. Factor out $(y - 3)$: $(y - 3)(3y + 4)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $mn - 3m + 2n - 6$
questions.explanation: Group: $(mn - 3m) + (2n - 6)$. Factor each group: $m(n - 3) + 2(n - 3)$. Factor out $(n - 3)$: $(n - 3)(m + 2)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $2ab + 8a + 3b + 12$
questions.explanation: Group: $(2ab + 8a) + (3b + 12)$. Factor each group: $2a(b + 4) + 3(b + 4)$. Factor out $(b + 4)$: $(b + 4)(2a + 3)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $3a^3 - 6a^2 + 5a - 10$
questions.explanation: Group: $(3a^3 - 6a^2) + (5a - 10)$. Factor GCFs: $3a^2(a - 2) + 5(a - 2)$. This results in $(3a^2 + 5)(a - 2)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $x^3 + 2x^2 - 4x - 8$
questions.explanation: Initial grouping gives $(x^2-4)(x+2)$. To factor 'completely', we must factor the difference of squares: $(x+2)(x-2)(x+2)$, which simplifies to $(x+2)^2(x-2)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $6p^2 - 9pq + 4pr - 6qr$
questions.explanation: Group: $(6p^2 - 9pq) + (4pr - 6qr)$. Factor each group: $3p(2p - 3q) + 2r(2p - 3q)$. Factor out $(2p - 3q)$: $(2p - 3q)(3p + 2r)$.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered factoring by grouping.
scoreMessages.70: Strong grouping skills! Focus on identifying common binomial factors.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice checking that binomials match before finishing.
scoreMessages.0: Keep practicing! Remember to group the first two and last two terms as a starting point.
